intro: Erechtites argutus var. glomeratus, commonly known as the clustered roughleaf sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the central and southeastern United States. It is characterized by its rough, hairy leaves and yellow composite flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils along roadsides and in open woodlands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological studies and native plant gardening.
